column36: Description
True Loyalty comes from respect. Inspire your followers so they understand that you are worthy of it.
A well-timed rally from a capable leader can turn the tide of battle as much as a well-thought plan.
Just a piece of bait. Even the mightiest can fall to the weakest in the right circumstance.
The right plan and action can only be implemented with the right information. One wrong placement of a piece can render the whole operation crumble.
Location is a deciding factor in most battles. A forced march may ensure that you can secure an advantageous position before the enemy.
Deaths are preferable to defeat. The commander orders, and the troops obey such is the will of an army. One final march.
Soldiers quivering in fear is no better than unarmed civilians. What use is their weapon if they are not going to wield it against their enemies?
Only willpower brings a dream to reality. Determination begets success or so the saying goes.
A simple encouragement can go a long way to make the weak become the strong.
Morale is everything in battle. A battle can only go on when the troops are willing to fight. Now just take that out of the equation and a fight will turn into a massacre.
A simple demonstration of true power. They only need to see to know defeat. The ultimate feat of victory to win a war without waging a single battle .
A quick and efficient retreat is a tactic every good leader must know. Why waste your troops on a losing battle when a winning one is possible later on?
The best defence is a good offence. Receive, gauge, and then retaliate. Let the enemy makes the first move allows you to select the best countermeasure.
The enemy one should fight with is the enemy unprepared for battle. No one can really efficiently plan against an unseen enemy.
Running away and conserving your troops to save the day. This is the way to win the war.
No disobedience is allowed and total control must be maintained.
Purity of the soul and mind reaching the status of divinity. No mere man can hope to accomplish such a feat.

The star aligns, and it is time for the dynasty to change. Some say the ruler's throne has a will of its own, and it will choose only those who deserve of it. No one can deny destiny. Not even the conqueror himself.
Complete control over land is now established under the supreme leadership. The battle is simply as good as over.
The hunting party is commenced. All are nothing more than prey in the eyes of true hunters.
Some curses are worse than death. This one is definitely one of those.
A sound from a warhorn can be heard throughout a battlefield, which makes it wonderful for an important signal or boosting the troops' morale.
Only those with might can truly rule. The strongs not only survive, they can exploit, dominate, and eradicate the weaks at will.
All will can crumble. A simple trick to the mind and even the strongest of will shall fall to the string of manipulation.
